title: Roll of Two Dice
question_text:
Two friends are playing a board game. One friend decides to find the mean of the sum of his last three rolls. His $3$ rolls are shown below:
$3$ Rolls: $8, 7, 6$ for a mean sum of $7$.
Is this friend's next three rolls guaranteed to be equal to $7$?

choices.text: No, because rolling $2$ dice produces random sums
No, because $8, 7$ & $6$ have been rolled and can't be rolled again
No, because a sum of $7$ has a probability of $\frac{1}{6}$, so it won't happen for $5$ more turns
Yes, because the mean will always be $7$ as it's the most likely outcome
Yes, because we divide by $3$ the mean will always be $7$
